meanings.definition: The series of vertebrae extending from the skull to the pelvis in humans and other vertebrates, enclosing and protecting the spinal cord.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that the backbones are crucial for supporting our body and protecting the spinal cord.
meanings.sent2: She felt a sharp pain in her backbones after lifting heavy boxes all day.
meanings.sent3: The backbones of the operation, the dedicated team, worked tirelessly to ensure success.
meanings.sent4: In a way, the backbones of society are the hardworking individuals who keep everything together.
meanings.sent5: The image of the backbones, like a strong pillar, held up the structure of the body in the anatomy class.

meanings.definition: The chief support or mainstay of a system or organization.
meanings.sent1: Trust is the backbones of any successful relationship.
meanings.sent2: The backbones of the company, the experienced employees, guided the new recruits.
meanings.sent3: The backbones of the party, the music and food, made the event a hit.
meanings.sent4: Honesty and integrity form the backbones of a strong character.
meanings.sent5: The backbones of the bridge, the sturdy steel beams, held up the weight of the cars above.
